articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Explosions reverberated across the pre-dawn sky as Ukrainian air defences fended off a Russian attack on this small city in western Ukraine, home to an important air base and a frequent target of Moscow's strikes.
articles.title: Ukrainian air base under fire as Russia aims at F-16 arrivals

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamic Jihad group fired a barrage of rockets into Israel on Monday, in an apparent show of force as Israeli tanks pressed their advance deeper into Gaza amid fierce fighting, residents and officials said.
articles.title: Gaza militants fire rockets into Israel, as tanks advance in north and south

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN) party scored historic gains to win the first round of France's parliamentary election, but the final outcome will depend on days of alliance-building before next week's run-off vote.
articles.title: Historic win for far right in French first-round vote

articles.author: John Kruzel, Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court found on Monday that Donald Trump cannot be prosecuted for any actions that were within his constitutional powers as president, but can for private acts, in a landmark ruling recognizing for the first time any form of presidential immunity from prosecution.
articles.title: US Supreme Court rules Trump has immunity for official, not private acts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl barrelled across the Atlantic Ocean toward the Caribbean's Windward Islands as an "extremely dangerous" storm on Monday, threatening to devastate communities with floods, storm surges and life-threatening high winds, officials said.
articles.title: 'Extremely dangerous' Hurricane Beryl hurtles towards Caribbean

articles.author: Paul Sandle
articles.description: Britain's finance minister Jeremy Hunt is fighting for his political life in affluent Godalming, south-east England, where a growing number of voters say they no longer recognise the values of his Conservative Party as their own.
articles.title: Jeremy Hunt in knife-edge election battle as UK Conservative voters lose faith

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: North Korea said it successfully tested a new tactical ballistic missile on Monday capable of carrying a 4.5-ton super-large warhead, state news agency KCNA reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea says it tested ballistic missile capable of carrying super-large warhead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Chinese Coast Guard's actions against Philippine vessels carrying out a routine resupply mission to a contested shoal in the South China Sea last month were the "most aggressive" in recent history, a senior Philippine navy official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Philippines says June 17 South China Sea incident 'most aggressive' recent Chinese action

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian police said on Tuesday it had arrested a 14-year-old boy after a stabbing at the University of Sydney.
articles.title: Australia police arrests 14-year-old boy after stabbing at Sydney university

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ten activists from the Cambodian environmental group Mother Nature were found guilty on charges of plotting against the government and insulting the king, the group's founder said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Cambodian court jails environmental activists for plotting against government
